com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell

Interface KillableObserver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TimeoutKillableObserver

    public interface KillableObserver
    Implementations of this interface observe, and potentially kill, a Killable object. This is the mechanism by which "kill" functionality is exposed to callers in the Command.execute(byte[], KillableObserver, boolean) method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void startObserving(Killable killable)
      Begin observing the given Killable.
      void stopObserving(Killable killable)
      Stop observing the given Killable, since it is no longer active.

    • Method Detail

      • startObserving

        void startObserving(Killable killable)

        Begin observing the given Killable. This method must return promptly; until it returns, Command.execute() cannot complete. Implementations may wish to start a new Thread here to handle kill logic, and to interrupt or otherwise ask the thread to stop in the stopObserving(Killable) method. See Interrupting Java threads for notes on how to implement this correctly.

        Implementations may or may not be able to observe more than one Killable at a time; see javadoc for details.

        Parameters:
        killable - killable to observer

      • stopObserving

        void stopObserving(Killable killable)
        Stop observing the given Killable, since it is no longer active.
